column3: The geometry indicates the official or recommended entrance to the site or the point where access is easiest.
The polygon indicates the extent of a buffer, usually a zone of protection beyond the known limits of the site
A line which divides the site in half
A point which indicates the geometric centre of the site
A point which indicates the position of the façade or front of a structure

column2: شكل مضلع لامتداد معروف لمبنى ما
column3: A polygon which marks the known horizontal extent of the site or feature being recorded

column2: شكل منتظم أو مضلع لحدود مبان حديثة
column3: A line or polygon which indicates the edge(s) of the modern property according to its legal ownership, which may differ from the original/ancient boundaries of the site
Location of the site datum used for surveying
A polygon which simplifies the shape of an area with very irregular or difficult to draw boundaries

column2: الموقع بالنسبة إلى أقرب إحدائية مساحة
column3: A point marking the approximate location of a site or feature based on available evidence but when the exact location is not precisely known
